judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Walling, Simpson, Kephart, Schaefer and Maxey, JJ.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The judgment in this case is affirmed on the opinion of the Superior Court. Costs to be paid by appellant.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Cecil P. Harvey, of Hornstein, Feldman & Harvey, with Mm Thomas O. Haydock, Jr., and Duane E. Dills, of Dills & Towley, of New York, for appellant.
William B. Toal, Assistant District Attorney, with Mm William J. MacCarter, Jr., District Attorney, for appellee.
Oscar Or. Wickersham, of Wickersham & Wickersham, amicus curiae, for Manufacturers’ Finance Acceptance Corporation.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth v. Bowers, Appellant.
Argued May 11, 1931.
Before Frazer, C. J., Walling, Simpson, Kephart, Schaefer and Maxey, JJ.
May 25, 1931:
Cecil P. Harvey, of Hornstein, Feldman & Harvey, with Mm Thomas O. Haydock, Jr., and Duane E. Dills, of Dills & Towley, of New York, for appellant.
William B. Toal, Assistant District Attorney, with Mm William J. MacCarter, Jr., District Attorney, for appellee.
Oscar Or. Wickersham, of Wickersham & Wickersham, amicus curiae, for Manufacturers’ Finance Acceptance Corporation.
